intro: Deyeuxia glabra, commonly known as silky grass or smooth sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is a perennial grass that typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often found in temperate regions. The plant has slender, cylindrical stems that are usually smooth to the touch, hence its common name. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a bluish-green hue. Deyeuxia glabra produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are characteristic of the grass family.
